pubspec.name: engine_security
pubspec.description: Advanced security detection system for Flutter applications focused on Android and iOS. Detects Frida, Root/Jailbreak, Emulator, and Debugger threats with high precision.

sections.title: Provide documentation
sections.summary:
### [*] 10/10 points: 20% or more of the public API has dartdoc comments

27 out of 61 API elements (44.3 %) have documentation comments.

Some symbols that are missing documentation: `engine_security`, `engine_security.DetectorInfoModel`, `engine_security.DetectorInfoModel.DetectorInfoModel.new`, `engine_security.DetectorInfoModel.enabled`, `engine_security.DetectorInfoModel.name`.

### [*] 10/10 points: Package has an example

sections.title: Platform support
sections.summary:
### [*] 20/20 points: Supports 2 of 6 possible platforms (**iOS**, **Android**, Web, Windows, macOS, Linux)

* ✓ Android

* ✓ iOS


These platforms are not supported:

<details>
<summary>
Package does not support platform `Windows`.
</summary>

Because:
* `package:engine_security/engine_security.dart` that declares support for platforms: `Android`, `iOS`.
</details>

<details>

</summary>

</details>

### [x] 0/0 points: WASM compatibility

<details>
<summary>
Package not compatible with runtime wasm
</summary>

Because:
* `package:engine_security/engine_security.dart` that imports:
* `package:engine_security/src/src.dart` that imports:
* `package:engine_security/src/detectors/detectors.dart` that imports:
* `package:engine_security/src/detectors/engine_root_detector.dart` that imports:
* `dart:io`
</details>

This package is not compatible with runtime `wasm`, and will not be rewarded full points in a future version of the scoring model.

See https://dart.dev/web/wasm for details.
